programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: (2004) Revenge thriller with Denzel Washington. An ex-CIA agent who's trying to start a new life in Mexico seeks brutal retribution when the girl who he's been hired to guard is kidnapped.

programme.title: Dead Presidents
programme.desc: (1995) Crime drama set in the Bronx of the 70s, starring Larenz Tate. To support his young family, a Vietnam veteran is driven to take part in the daring robbery of an armoured truck.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Carrington, VC
programme.desc: (1954) Anthony Asquith's vivid and subtle courtroom drama casts David Niven as the eponymous officer accused of stealing army money and going absent without leave.

programme.title: Django Unchained Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Quentin Tarantino and stars Samuel L Jackson, Christoph Waltz, Jamie Foxx and Kerry Washington talk about making the western adventure set against a backdrop of slavery.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny

programme.title: Genius Game
programme.desc: Game show in which David Tennant guides 11 players with exceptional abilities through a series of mind-bending rounds. Contestants need to work together to be successful in the game, but only one can ultimately win. In the opening edition, the players take on Gold Heist, a group game and their first Main Match, as one set works out a strategy to become the player with the most wealth, while a lone contender finds themselves vulnerable and penniless. Who will be going home?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by singer Tony Hadley, who samples kipper and black pudding cakes. Jimmy meets Jay at the wildlife park as he is shearing one of the rams, a member of a local rescue centre chats about how to help hedgehogs and Max makes off-grid appliances sure to impress any campers

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is in Bradford, where Alison Chapman has her eye on a jewellery gift for her 10-year-old granddaughter. Tim Hogarth consults a celebrity astrologer chum to make a profit on a silver deal, and David chips in to help a gold charm bracelet raise money for a good cause

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five players answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as Lucy from Manchester, Roy from Cardiff, Youssef originally from Cairo and Anne from Doncaster try to take on one of the country's finest quiz brains, but do they have the answers?

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paddy has a terrible realisation, Aaron is vulnerable and Robert is worried

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Debbie takes over the dementia choir, Roy runs into Evelyn at the hospital, Billy plays into Theo's hands, and Brody and Dylan get caught stealing a car. Elsewhere, George lends Christina a shoulder to cry on, and Carla and Lisa meet the mysterious Tia Wardley

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Julie Hesmondhalgh and Tony Bellew answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. With lifelines including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure sequel starring Woody Harrelson and Andy Serkis. In the third instalment of the rebooted franchise, ape leader Caesar embarks on a quest for revenge after the crazed Colonel McCullough kills Caesar's family in a bid to assassinate him.

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: Believing Tess to be the author of One Night, Eden tracks her down and asks her about the crime at the heart of the novel. Confused by Eden's claims, Tess is horrified to realise that Simone has written an anonymous novel about the night she was sexually assaulted. Australian drama, starring Jodie Whittaker and Jillian Nguyen

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Babatunde Aleshe, Lucy Pateman teaches Katie and Aldo about tablescaping, and Michael and Gen transform a charity ambassador.

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: The chef shares a collection of recipes involving cheese, including his take on baked Camembert, and home-made goat's cheese with a chicory and walnut salad

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as Lucy from Manchester, Roy from Cardiff, Youssef originally from Cairo and Anne from Doncaster try to take on one of the country's finest quiz brains, but do they have the answers?

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as the remaining four famous faces compete in the semi-final as they take on healthy dishes. The two stars who fail to impress the judges will end up in the cook-off, with the pair fighting it out for the last place in the grand final

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: The hosts are joined by Yvette Fielding, with Shivi Ramoutar serving up rosti with a fried egg for breakfast, while Jimmy Doherty gives the tapirs belly rubs at the wildlife park. After the team looks at some practical and tasty ways to reduce food waste, Shivi visits a farm practising agroforestry to find out how it works and what they're growing, while vet James Greenwood stops by to have a chat about how to read pets' behaviour

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood and there are recipes from chefs Ronnie Murray and Judy Joo

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley transports us to the vibrant and flavourful world of Caribbean cuisine as he starts with a fresh dish packed with flavour - jerk-style pork tenderloin, watermelon and coconut salad. Ainsley is joined by weatherman Alex Beresford, who cooks a taste of his childhood in the form of a goat curry, before the show is wrapped up with Ainsley's Jamaican beef patties

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing Live from Haydock
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the Sprint Cup from Haydock Park, plus racing from Ascot and Kempton Park. With analysis from Leonna Mayor and Rishi Persad and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: European Qualifier
programme.desc: England v Andorra (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the FIFA World Cup Group K qualifier at Villa Park. England won June's reverse fixture in Barcelona in underwhelming fashion, with Harry Kane scoring the only goal of the game. They will expect to produce a much stronger performance in front of their own fans to boost morale ahead of a potentially difficult encounter away to Serbia on Tuesday. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Win Win with People's Postcode Lottery
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins host an interactive quiz show in which viewers get the chance to win the same prizes as the 40 contestants playing in the studio. The competitors face the choice of taking a prize and leaving the game or trading it in to join Millionaire's Row, where someone is guaranteed to win £1,000,000 in the series finale

programme.title: You Bet! on Tour
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show as it travels around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win £5,000. Rob Beckett, Zoe Ball and Eddie Kadi are the members of the celebrity panel predicting if the challengers can complete the task with which they are faced

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: As One Night's success continues to grow, fractures among the three friends deepen. Simone witnesses Eden become the voice and face of her book online and in the media. Fed up with her book being 'stolen', Simone hatches a plan to put her name on the book. Hat fights to have it removed from shelves and Tess devises a revenge plan against the Calleys. Thriller, starring Nicole da Silva, Jodie Whittaker and Jillian Nguyen

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: James Cameron's science-fiction action thriller sequel to The Terminator, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton. Tormented by the imminent threat of a nuclear holocaust from which intelligent machines will emerge to crush the last vestiges of human existence, Sarah Connor has been institutionalised and separated from her son. Informed of the future, she knows that young John Connor will survive and become leader of the human race. However, the machines of 2029 know it too, and once again they send a cyborg assassin back through time to terminate the potential saviour.

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: Courtroom drama about the secret lives of jury members.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Cameras focus on a cat whose weight loss is concerning his owner. Fern also meets a Pomeranian who is booked in for a spay, and a Boston Terrier who is undergoing vital hi-tech eye treatment. Plus, Dr James Greenwood attempts to uncover why a Labrador is off their food

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Raymond makes onion and bacon pithivier and rhubarb with homemade ricotta

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood and there are recipes from chefs Ronnie Murray and Judy Joo

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by TV presenter Jake Humphrey, while Michael Douglas and Genevieve Turley transform a woman who has fostered more than 50 children. Jack Kinsey teaches Katie and Aldo Zilli about tablescaping

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Queen of Crime Lynda La Plante, Gareth Malone, and Kelvin and Liz Fletcher join Alan to provide the chat, and we also meet some rare breed Tamworth pigs.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh surprises a group of senior citizens in Thornton Heath, turning an urban wasteland into a welcoming oasis of swaying grasses and pretty daisy flowers. The experts share tips on how to achieve the look of a miniature prairie even in a tiny space, the tricks to creating a cost-effective water feature from skip material, and how to choose the best low-maintenance shrubs to green up even the shadiest of spots

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. In this episode, cameras follow the vets and nursing staff who have welcomed Fern into their practice while she assists in the completion of doggy dentistry on a spaniel. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Angus, a member of the Bleakridge Watch, a group of villagers who walk the streets reporting anyone who falls foul of the law, is found dead in his meat freezer. Barnaby and Winter meet Angus's devastated sister and her daughter and learn that Angus was investigating a recent spate of burglaries in the village, but had yet to identify the culprit. Angus' post-mortem reveals strange restraining injuries on his wrists and the plot thickens as Barnaby discovers just how far some people will go for power. Frances Barber guest stars as the leader of the Watch

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Period drama starring Hugh Bonneville, Elizabeth McGovern and Maggie Smith. When the Crawley family receive word that the King and Queen are to visit, the estate is thrown into a frenzy of preparation. As Lady Mary brings butler Carson out of retirement for the occasion, the house staff clash with the royal company, and various smaller personal dramas play out both upstairs and downstairs.

programme.title: You Bet! on Tour
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show as it travels around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win £5,000. Rob Beckett, Zoe Ball and Eddie Kadi are the members of the celebrity panel predicting if the challengers can complete the task with which they are faced

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the grand final of the celebrity cooking contest - and the pressure is on as the three remaining stars battle it out in their toughest challenge yet. They take on their mentors' signature dishes and the two who make it through to the final round will have to deliver a three-course meal in an epic head-to-head battle in a bid to lift the Golden Frying Pan

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Contestants from across the UK take on a team of Chasers, hoping to win big money. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: At the retrial for Julie's murder, the jury once again cannot reach a verdict. Ann finds herself at her lowest point as she faces the challenge of rebuilding her life while her daughter's murderer is at large in the community. Horrifyingly, the killer begins to brag about how he got away with the perfect murder, knowing he is protected by the double jeopardy law. With the Crown having seemingly exhausted its powers, it's down to Ann to find justice for Julie, launching a campaign to change the 800-year-old law

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Lioness
programme.desc: Byron Westfield (Michael Kelly) oversee The Lioness Program, which is regarded as one of the sharpest weapons in the CIA arsenal in the ongoing war on terror. Joe (Zoe Saldana) is one of the program's best assets and she is asked to work closely with Cruz Manuelos (Laysla De Oliveira) to go undercover and prevent another terrorist outrage on American soil. Joe struggles to balance professional and personal lives in active service of her country

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 123
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and John Travolta star in this remake of the 1974 thriller. An armed gang holds passengers on a New York subway train hostage, and threatens to start killing them unless they receive a huge ransom. As the minutes tick by, the tense situation becomes a battle of wits between gang leader "Ryder" and train dispatcher Walter Garber.

programme.title: Genius Game
programme.desc: Game show in which David Tennant guides 11 players with exceptional abilities through a series of mind-bending rounds. Contestants need to work together to be successful in the game, but only one can ultimately win. In the opening edition, the players take on Gold Heist, a group game and their first Main Match, as one set works out a strategy to become the player with the most wealth, while a lone contender finds themselves vulnerable and penniless. Who will be going home?

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure sequel starring Woody Harrelson and Andy Serkis. In the third instalment of the rebooted franchise, ape leader Caesar embarks on a quest for revenge after the crazed Colonel McCullough kills Caesar's family in a bid to assassinate him.

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: Believing Tess to be the author of One Night, Eden tracks her down and asks her about the crime at the heart of the novel. Confused by Eden's claims, Tess is horrified to realise that Simone has written an anonymous novel about the night she was sexually assaulted. Australian drama, starring Jodie Whittaker and Jillian Nguyen

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Babatunde Aleshe, Lucy Pateman teaches Katie and Aldo about tablescaping, and Michael and Gen transform a charity ambassador.

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: The chef shares a collection of recipes involving cheese, including his take on baked Camembert, and home-made goat's cheese with a chicory and walnut salad

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as Lucy from Manchester, Roy from Cardiff, Youssef originally from Cairo and Anne from Doncaster try to take on one of the country's finest quiz brains, but do they have the answers?

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as the remaining four famous faces compete in the semi-final as they take on healthy dishes. The two stars who fail to impress the judges will end up in the cook-off, with the pair fighting it out for the last place in the grand final

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: The hosts are joined by Yvette Fielding, with Shivi Ramoutar serving up rosti with a fried egg for breakfast, while Jimmy Doherty gives the tapirs belly rubs at the wildlife park. After the team looks at some practical and tasty ways to reduce food waste, Shivi visits a farm practising agroforestry to find out how it works and what they're growing, while vet James Greenwood stops by to have a chat about how to read pets' behaviour

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood and there are recipes from chefs Ronnie Murray and Judy Joo

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley transports us to the vibrant and flavourful world of Caribbean cuisine as he starts with a fresh dish packed with flavour - jerk-style pork tenderloin, watermelon and coconut salad. Ainsley is joined by weatherman Alex Beresford, who cooks a taste of his childhood in the form of a goat curry, before the show is wrapped up with Ainsley's Jamaican beef patties

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing Live from Haydock
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the Sprint Cup from Haydock Park, plus racing from Ascot and Kempton Park. With analysis from Leonna Mayor and Rishi Persad and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: European Qualifier
programme.desc: England v Andorra (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the FIFA World Cup Group K qualifier at Villa Park. England won June's reverse fixture in Barcelona in underwhelming fashion, with Harry Kane scoring the only goal of the game. They will expect to produce a much stronger performance in front of their own fans to boost morale ahead of a potentially difficult encounter away to Serbia on Tuesday. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Win Win with People's Postcode Lottery
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins host an interactive quiz show in which viewers get the chance to win the same prizes as the 40 contestants playing in the studio. The competitors face the choice of taking a prize and leaving the game or trading it in to join Millionaire's Row, where someone is guaranteed to win £1,000,000 in the series finale

programme.title: You Bet! on Tour
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show as it travels around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win £5,000. Rob Beckett, Zoe Ball and Eddie Kadi are the members of the celebrity panel predicting if the challengers can complete the task with which they are faced

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: As One Night's success continues to grow, fractures among the three friends deepen. Simone witnesses Eden become the voice and face of her book online and in the media. Fed up with her book being 'stolen', Simone hatches a plan to put her name on the book. Hat fights to have it removed from shelves and Tess devises a revenge plan against the Calleys. Thriller, starring Nicole da Silva, Jodie Whittaker and Jillian Nguyen

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: James Cameron's science-fiction action thriller sequel to The Terminator, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton. Tormented by the imminent threat of a nuclear holocaust from which intelligent machines will emerge to crush the last vestiges of human existence, Sarah Connor has been institutionalised and separated from her son. Informed of the future, she knows that young John Connor will survive and become leader of the human race. However, the machines of 2029 know it too, and once again they send a cyborg assassin back through time to terminate the potential saviour.

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: Courtroom drama about the secret lives of jury members.

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Cameras focus on a cat whose weight loss is concerning his owner. Fern also meets a Pomeranian who is booked in for a spay, and a Boston Terrier who is undergoing vital hi-tech eye treatment. Plus, Dr James Greenwood attempts to uncover why a Labrador is off their food

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Raymond makes onion and bacon pithivier and rhubarb with homemade ricotta

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood and there are recipes from chefs Ronnie Murray and Judy Joo

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Queen of Crime Lynda La Plante, Gareth Malone, and Kelvin and Liz Fletcher join Alan to provide the chat, and we also meet some rare breed Tamworth pigs.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh surprises a group of senior citizens in Thornton Heath, turning an urban wasteland into a welcoming oasis of swaying grasses and pretty daisy flowers. The experts share tips on how to achieve the look of a miniature prairie even in a tiny space, the tricks to creating a cost-effective water feature from skip material, and how to choose the best low-maintenance shrubs to green up even the shadiest of spots

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. In this episode, cameras follow the vets and nursing staff who have welcomed Fern into their practice while she assists in the completion of doggy dentistry on a spaniel. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Angus, a member of the Bleakridge Watch, a group of villagers who walk the streets reporting anyone who falls foul of the law, is found dead in his meat freezer. Barnaby and Winter meet Angus's devastated sister and her daughter and learn that Angus was investigating a recent spate of burglaries in the village, but had yet to identify the culprit. Angus' post-mortem reveals strange restraining injuries on his wrists and the plot thickens as Barnaby discovers just how far some people will go for power. Frances Barber guest stars as the leader of the Watch

programme.desc: Angus, a member of the Bleakridge Watch, a group of villagers who walk the streets reporting anyone who falls foul of the law, is found dead in his meat freezer. Barnaby and Winter meet Angus's devastated sister and her daughter and learn that Angus was investigating a recent spate of burglaries in the village, but had yet to identify the culprit. Angus' post-mortem reveals strange restraining injuries on his wrists and the plot thickens as Barnaby discovers just how far some people will go for power. Frances Barber guest stars as the leader of the Watch

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Period drama starring Hugh Bonneville, Elizabeth McGovern and Maggie Smith. When the Crawley family receive word that the King and Queen are to visit, the estate is thrown into a frenzy of preparation. As Lady Mary brings butler Carson out of retirement for the occasion, the house staff clash with the royal company, and various smaller personal dramas play out both upstairs and downstairs.

programme.title: You Bet! on Tour
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show as it travels around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win £5,000. Rob Beckett, Zoe Ball and Eddie Kadi are the members of the celebrity panel predicting if the challengers can complete the task with which they are faced

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars

They take on their mentors' signature dishes and the two who make it through to the final round will have to deliver a three-course meal in an epic head-to-head battle in a bid to lift the Golden Frying Pan

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Contestants from across the UK take on a team of Chasers, hoping to win big money. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: At the retrial for Julie's murder, the jury once again cannot reach a verdict. Ann finds herself at her lowest point as she faces the challenge of rebuilding her life while her daughter's murderer is at large in the community. Horrifyingly, the killer begins to brag about how he got away with the perfect murder, knowing he is protected by the double jeopardy law. With the Crown having seemingly exhausted its powers, it's down to Ann to find justice for Julie, launching a campaign to change the 800-year-old law

programme.title: Lioness

Joe struggles to balance professional and personal lives in active service of her country

As the minutes tick by, the tense situation becomes a battle of wits between gang leader "Ryder" and train dispatcher Walter Garber.

Contestants need to work together to be successful in the game, but only one can ultimately win. In the opening edition, the players take on Gold Heist, a group game and their first Main Match, as one set works out a strategy to become the player with the most wealth, while a lone contender finds themselves vulnerable and penniless. Who will be going home?

England won June's reverse fixture in Barcelona in underwhelming fashion, with Harry Kane scoring the only goal of the game. They will expect to produce a much stronger performance in front of their own fans to boost morale ahead of a potentially difficult encounter away to Serbia on Tuesday. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.desc: James Cameron's science-fiction action thriller sequel to The Terminator, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton. Tormented by the imminent threat of a nuclear holocaust from which intelligent machines will emerge to crush the last vestiges of human existence, Sarah Connor has been institutionalised and separated from her son. Informed of the future, she knows that young John Connor will survive and become leader of the human race. However, the machines of 2029 know it too, and once again they send a cyborg assassin back through time to terminate the potential saviour.
